samples.question: How often do you go to the cinema?
samples.transcript: To be honest, I go to the cinema maybe once in a month, not that often, but I would say once in a month or twice in a month. Okay.
samples.transcript_original: Um, to be honest, I go to the cinema maybe once in a month, not that often, but I would say once in a month or twice in a month. Okay.
samples.transcript_cleaned: To be honest, I go to the cinema maybe once in a month, not that often, but I would say once in a month or twice in a month.

samples.question: Are cinema tickets expensive in your country?
samples.transcript: I would say in my country it is kind of pricey, so, but in Korea I would say it is kind of affordable. So even me being a student here, I can afford buying a ticket.
samples.transcript_original: I would say in my country it's kind of pricey, so, um, but in Korea I would say it's kind of affordable. So even me being a student here, I can afford buying a ticket.
samples.transcript_cleaned: I would say in my country it is kind of pricey, so, but in Korea I would say it is kind of affordable. So even me being a student here, I can afford buying a ticket.

samples.question: Okay, what are the advantages of seeing a film at a cinema?
samples.transcript: Frankly speaking, watching movies at a cinema is, has more advantages than just watching at home unless it is so calm and you can relax in there and you can focus on the movie and the plot. So, yeah.
samples.transcript_original: Uh, frankly speaking, watching movies at a cinema is, has more advantages than just watching at home unless it's so calm and you can relax in there and you can focus on the movie and the plot. So, yeah.
samples.transcript_cleaned: Frankly speaking, watching movies at a cinema is, has more advantages than just watching at home unless it is so calm and you can relax in there and you can focus on the movie and the plot.

samples.question: Okay, and do you usually watch films alone or go with others?
samples.transcript: I would say I go to the cinema with my boyfriend usually. So I do not really like watching movies alone. it is boring.
samples.transcript_original: I would say I go to the cinema with my boyfriend usually. So I don't really like watching movies alone. It's boring.
samples.transcript_cleaned: I would say I go to the cinema with my boyfriend usually. So I do not really like watching movies alone. it is boring.

samples.question: Which actor would you like to play you in a film?
samples.transcript: Oh, that is an interesting one. I would play spy maybe. Like unless I really like Marvel movies and yeah, I would play a spy role. Okay, now we are going to talk about music.
samples.transcript_original: Oh, that's an interesting one. I would play spy maybe. Like unless I really like Marvel movies and yeah, I would play a spy role. Okay, now we are going to talk about music.

samples.question: How do you listen to music?
samples.transcript: Oh, I usually listen to music, in my earphones, so yeah, that is the.
samples.transcript_original: Oh, I usually listen to music, um, in my earphones, so yeah, that's the.
samples.transcript_cleaned: Oh, I usually listen to music, in my earphones, so yeah, that is the.

samples.question: Okay, and when do you listen to music?
samples.transcript: Oh, I listen to music on my way to work or on my way to back home, so usually on the road.
samples.transcript_original: Oh, I listen to music on my way to work or on my way to back home, so usually on the road.

samples.question: Okay, what is your favorite kind of music?
samples.transcript: My favorite kind of music is hip-hop or rap, I would say. Yeah.
samples.transcript_original: My favorite kind of music is hip-hop or rap, I would say. Yeah.
samples.transcript_cleaned: My favorite kind of music is hip-hop or rap, I would say.

samples.question: Is music an important subject at school in your country?
samples.transcript: I would not say that. in my country people, they do not really pay, from my point of view, as much attention that music needs to be paid. so no, they do not really.

samples.question: Is family important in your country?
samples.transcript: Yeah, I would say family is one of the most important things in my country because unless we consider family as, I mean we consider parents as those who are giving you a kind of map to your future life. Yeah, so family is important in my country.
samples.transcript_original: Um, yeah, I would say family is one of the most important things in my country because unless we consider family as, uh, I mean we consider parents as those who are giving you a kind of map to your future life. Yeah, so family is important in my country.

samples.question: Should it be the family or the government?
samples.transcript: I feel like both. it is important for a family to take care of elders too, but for government is more important or less, because, the elders, they have, I mean, they have been working a lot before for government and, yeah, I think, Government and family. Okay.
samples.transcript_original: Um, I feel like both. samples.question: How has the size of the average family changed in your country over the last decades?
samples.transcript: Over the last decades is, it is changed dramatically I would say because maybe like 20 years ago, they were about, there were about five to ten maybe children in one family in my country. But nowadays I think it is because of financial problems and you know like it is these days it is so hard to keep your kids satisfied. So yeah, these days like three to four kids in average.

samples.question: Okay, and how do you think families will change in the future?

samples.question: And can you tell me something about your hometown too?

samples.question: Do you enjoy dancing?
samples.transcript: Yes indeed, I love dancing. I have been fond of dancing since I was a kid and as far as I can remember, at some point I even had this dream of becoming a professional dancer but eventually I gave up on that.

samples.question: Has anyone ever taught you to dance?
samples.transcript: Yes, during lockdown, my mom and I, we watched several YouTube channels on dancing tutorials and we learnt a lot of steps. but my mom also, like me, gave up on that because she found it very hard and she required a lot of determination.
